sentences: Kwon Bo-ah (Korean: 권보아; born November 5, 1986), known professionally as BoA, is a South Korean singer, songwriter, dancer, record producer and actress.
section: N/A

sentences: One of the most successful and influential Korean entertainers, she has been dubbed the "Queen of K-pop."Born and raised in Gyeonggi-do, South Korea, BoA was discovered by SM Entertainment talent agents when she accompanied her older brother, a music video director, to a talent search in 1998.
section: N/A

sentences: She was trained for two years and made her debut in August 2000.
section: N/A

sentences: BoA has released twenty studio albums, including ten in Korean, nine in Japanese, and one in English.
section: N/A

sentences: On television, she appeared as a judge on the reality competition show K-pop Star (2011–2013), as an actress on the television drama Listen to Love (2016), as a host for the second season of Produce 101 (2017), and as a coach for the third season of The Voice of Korea (2020).
section: N/A

sentences: BoA's ability to sing in Japanese, English and Mandarin has helped her find commercial success beyond South Korea, in China, Japan, Taiwan, and Singapore.
section: N/A

sentences: With the release of her debut Japanese studio album, Listen to My Heart (2002), BoA became the first South Korean pop star to break through in Japan following the fall of barriers that had restricted the import and export of entertainment between the countries since the end of World War II.
section: N/A

sentences: She is the only foreign artist with three albums that have sold more than one million copies in Japan and one of only three female artists with six consecutive number-one studio albums on the Oricon charts since her debut, the others being Japanese singers Ayumi Hamasaki and Hikaru Utada.
section: N/A

== Image and artistry ==

sentences: Image and artistry
section: == Image and artistry ==
== Image and artistry ==

sentences: BoA lists hip hop as her main musical influence, though she also enjoys R&B.
section: == Image and artistry ==

sentences: Her favorite musicians are Whitney Houston, Michael Jackson, Justin Timberlake, and Ne-Yo; as a result, much of BoA's music is either dance-pop or R&B.
section: == Image and artistry ==

sentences: Because she also sings ballads, she is often compared to Japanese singers Namie Amuro and Ayumi Hamasaki.
section: == Image and artistry ==

sentences: Her debut album, ID; Peace B, contained urban pop, "slickly produced" ballads, and "upbeat dance tunes".
section: == Image and artistry ==

sentences: As her career went on, she began experimenting with different styles: Valenti contained mostly ballads; Love and Honesty was an experiment with "harder" R&B and rock music.
section: == Image and artistry ==

sentences: The Face was influenced by electropop and included "happy spring" songs ("Sweet Impact" and "Bad Drive"), a guitar-driven "groovy dance" song ("Lose Your Mind"), and ballads.
section: == Image and artistry ==

sentences: Because the composition and writing of BoA's songs is handled mostly by her staff, BoA has been criticized as being a "manufactured pop star".
section: == Image and artistry ==

sentences: In response to such criticism, BoA said that "if one person were to force their own will on something, then things that should have gone right could easily go wrong" and that she is "not all that unhappy with the expression that [she is] a manufactured star.
section: == Image and artistry ==

sentences: In a way, that is true.
section: == Image and artistry ==

sentences: Because SM Entertainment created the environment and all the surrounding conditions, [she is] able to be successful in the way [she is] now."
section: == Image and artistry ==

sentences: She later assumed creative control with The Face, while Kiss My Lips became her first entirely self-written, self-produced album.
section: == Image and artistry ==

sentences: BoA has collaborated with high-profile artists.
section: == Image and artistry ==

sentences: Among the Japanese artists she has performed with are the hip hop group M-Flo (for the single "The Love Bug"), pop singer Kumi Koda, and house DJ Mondo Grosso.
section: == Image and artistry ==

sentences: She has performed with Western artists: the song "Flying Without Wings" from her album Next World was a collaboration with Irish band Westlife covering the original song; the Bratz single "Show Me What You Got" was performed with Howie D of the American band Backstreet Boys.
section: == Image and artistry ==

sentences: She also worked with Akon, singing the song "Beautiful", which was featured on the Japanese release of his third album, Freedom.
section: == Image and artistry ==

sentences: Other artists she has collaborated with are Soul'd Out, Dabo, Verbal (of M-Flo), Rah-D, Seamo, TVXQ, Yutaka Furakawa (of the band Doping Panda), and Crystal Kay (for her single After Love: First Boyfriend/Girlfriend).
section: == Image and artistry ==

sentences: American rock band Weezer covered "Meri Kuri" on the Japanese version of their album Weezer.

== Impact ==

sentences: Impact ==
section: == Impact ==

sentences: Dubbed the "Queen of K-pop", BoA is considered one of this century's top artists in East Asia; her popularity in the latter is attributed to her linguistic skills (she speaks and records in Japanese, Korean, and English) and a Japanese interest in Korean pop culture started in the early 2000s when the two countries began promoting cultural exchanges.
section: == Impact ==

sentences: BoA's popularity extends throughout East Asia; she has fans in China, Hong Kong, Singapore and Taiwan.
section: == Impact ==

sentences: She had expressed plans to enter a global market; in June 2006, the music video of her Korean song "My Name" became the first music video ever shown on MTV K, an MTV music channel directed at Korean Americans.
section: == Impact ==

sentences: Though her earlier releases were marked by a "cute" and "youthful" style, BoA began to present a more "mature" image starting from the album My Name.
section: == Impact ==

sentences: In a Talk Asia interview, Anjali Rao noted that some felt that My Name marked the beginning of BoA's decline in popularity and asked if the public would always see the singer as "Little Baby BoA"; BoA replied, "So while I apologize to those people who still want the baby BoA, in fact, what can I do?
section: == Impact ==
